title: Understanding Matrix Inversion
text: Before trying to find the inverse, let's discuss when a matrix can have an inverse. A 2x2 matrix has an inverse if and only if its determinant is not zero.

title: Calculating the Determinant
text: For a matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$, the determinant is calculated as ad-bc. Try calculating the determinant for $$\begin{bmatrix} -3 & 7 \\ 9 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$$.

title: Evaluate the Determinant
text: Compute the value of the determinant for $$\begin{bmatrix} -3 & 7 \\ 9 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$$.

title: Condition for Invertibility
text: Since the determinant is not zero, the matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} -3 & 7 \\ 9 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$$ has an inverse. Let's proceed to find it.

title: Formula for the Inverse Matrix
text: If the determinant of the matrix is non-zero, the inverse of a matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$ is $$\frac{1}{ad-bc}$$ times $$\begin{bmatrix} d & -b \\ -c & a \end{bmatrix}$$. Remember this involves calculating the reciprocal of the determinant!

title: Apply the Inverse Formula
text: Substitute the values from $$\begin{bmatrix} -3 & 7 \\ 9 & 2 \end{bmatrix}$$ into the inverse formula and simplify to find each matrix element.

title: Final Thoughts on Matrix Inversion
text: After applying the inverse formula, check your calculations to ensure each step correctly follows the determinant and inverse formula.
